instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.PP1V5_S3RS0: What is PP1V5_S3RS0? PP1V5_S3RS0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.DDRREG_EN: What is DDRREG_EN? DDRREG_EN is an enable signal that turns on power rails for DDR memory.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: 820 2936 - Green light  and orange but don't turn on!
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

this board have been to another store, and they messed with <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and a few components! 

i have:




<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.48v

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> - 5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 3.29v

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> -1.8v

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> -0.365V

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0</SIGNAL> -0.365V

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> -1.5v

<SIGNAL>PPVTTDDR_S3</SIGNAL> -.75v

<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> -0v

<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> -.90v

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> -1.32v

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> - 1.035v


any idea??

threads.title: 820 2936 - Green light  and orange but don't turn on!
threads.message:
It don't turn on? Why are some S0 voltages present then........Even Vcore is present so fan should be spinning. 

<SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DDRREG_EN</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: 820 2936 - Green light  and orange but don't turn on!
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is missing this is junk

threads.title: 820 2936 - Green light  and orange but don't turn on!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>DDRREG_EN</SIGNAL> = 0.230V

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 0V :( 

when i put the charger some times goes on 15 sec fan spin and off.when the fan is not spining even when pressing the button does not work. This board comes with some flux under PCH... I put the board in ultrassonic clean but it was enough...  

Dead Board ??

threads.title: 820 2936 - Green light  and orange but don't turn on!
threads.message: This one is a time waster, could be anything. Pre-fucked trash.
